ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Dalnir: any bard toys?
ygData.msgSnippet: nope, the Overseer (and the boss mob, forget his name) are both SUPPOSED to have a 1000dmg AE spell on them.  They cast it alot.  It was NOT toned down in the
ygData.messageBody:
nope, the Overseer (and the boss mob, forget his name) are both SUPPOSED to
have a 1000dmg AE spell on them. They cast it alot. It was NOT toned down
in the patch (the instance I am talking about occurred yesterday)

The Oozes and the casters in the dungeon have all been fixed though. Oozes
used to have a 900dmg DOT and the casters were casting 50th level spells
(they've been reduced down to the 20's and 30's that they should be at)

Overall Dalnir is a total bore. (90% of it is green at 40th). The boss mob
and his PH are absolute hell (though 40+ casters with pets can take him
pretty easily). A really good group with a full cleric might be able to do
it too. An enchanter is a must unless you're just going to pet/root/nuke

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Randy Keith" <Kalekona@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, May 27, 2000 12:51 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Dalnir: any bard toys?


> Well, they did patch saying that Dalnir mobs were casting spells WELL
above thier ability. Hopefully that
> was fixed.
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur wrote:
>
> > Only thing you need in Dalnir is off the Kly Imprecator (sp?). The
ancient
> > coin (Royal Crown of Dalnir) for the Ancient Coin Quest
> >
> > Hehe. And I got one long before I went to Dalnir.
> >
> > HOWEVER:
> > The boss mob of the dungeon drops the Necklace of Superiority or
whatever.
> >
> > 5AC, +5 to all stats. +10 to all resists.
> >
> > Be warned: His placeholder has a 1000dmg AOE Attack. So does he and he
has
> > 2x the hp.
> >
> > The placeholder (Kly Overseer) dropped a full group of 6 40+ members
> >
> > (oh, did I mention he was blue to level 39 ?)
> >
> > Lyrnia Jongleur
> > Bard of Norrath
> > <Travelers of Norrath>
> >
> > > We're starting to explore Dalnir now in force. I'm told there's bard
> > stuff
> > > there but I think it's just a ploy to get me to log in my bard.
> > >
> > > Without huge spoilers, anything a bard can look forward to in here?
> > Cleric?
> > >
> > > Of course I'll continue going even if there's just xp and good times
> > alone,
> > > it's just nice to have a goal.
> > >
> > > (admit it, lower guk was a lot more exciting to explore when you saw
what
> > > people were hauling out of there :P)
> > >
